intro: Acmispon greenei, commonly known as the Greene's prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Acmispon greenei is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
